messages.message: Sometimes there is a legitimate reason to need to modify the contents of those directories, can we just warn about making changes here instead?

@Lee What are some of these reasons to change the files in the output? I think we should try and support them through our apps instead of letting the users edit through file system or text editor. Arbitrary changes to these output files just makes it really hard to make our apps stable cuz there's too many edge cases to account for.

Hey @Eric Han. It’s rare to modify the files, but sometimes as a part of the UDFs we need to combine multiple records into a single record, or split a single record out. An example of this is with some use cases where files and then future amendments are processed. We detect the amendments and combine with the original into a single record.
We do this via the UDF libraries.

@Nidhi is there a way via file service to do that? afaik there's not a easy way via permissions. we'd have to give those people custom roles and dynamically set their fs permissions, which would not be ideal

Let’s not rush into any features because apparently there are many usage patterns, we don’t know all of them. I think the first important step is user education. Before we change the behavior, let’s improve our docs and training materials so how flow results are retrieved are clear to everyone, at least our power users and our own people. The syndrome here is clear - if people modify the flow output folder, some unexpected behaviors might happen. Let’s define those “unexpected behaviors”, educate everyone and give ourself some time to come up with a good solution.
